channel.title: Help with choosing a Graphics Card
channel.description: Ok, Right now in my PC i have a x800 GTO 128mb of memory and Iam wondering if i should buy a x1600 pro i think 256mb of memory instead... Please help they seem so much alike.. >.<

item.title: Help with choosing a Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

moparisthebest:

Nvidia is always better than anything else, DO NOT buy an ATI card because they suck. Look at newegg.com for good prices, and if you want us to help you choose one post what kind of interface you need and what kind of money you are willing to spend.

Both my PC’s have had ATI cards, my laptop ATI gfx card actually has better performance than my desktop ATI card.

A few suggestions:

Low End:
Nvidia 6200 128/256MB!^
Nvidia 7100/7200 ***MB^
Nvidia 6600LE 128/256MB^
Nvidia 7300GS 128/256MB^

Low Mid range:
ATI X1300/Pro 128/256MB/512MB!^
nVidia Geforce 6600 128/256MB!^
nVidia Geforce 7300GT 128/256MB!^

Mid range:
nVidia Geforce 6600GT/6800/6800XT 128/256MB!^
ATI X1600Pro/X1300XT 256MB/512MB!^
ATI X1650Pro/X1600XT 256MB^
nVidia Geforce 7600GS 256MB!^

High range:
ATI X1650XT 256MB^
nVidia Geforce 7600GT 256MB!^
nVidia Geforce 6800GT/Ultra 256MB!^
nVidia Geforce 7800GS 256MB!

Ultra-High end:
nVidia Geforce 7900GS 256MB^
ATI X1950Pro 256MB^
ATI X1900XT 256MB^
nVidia Geforce 7950GT 512MB^

Amazingly High-end - currently the best
ATI X1900XT/XTX 512MB^
nVidia Geforce 7900GTX 512MB^
nVidia Geforce 8800GTS 640MB ^
ATI X1950XTX 512MB^
nVidia Geforce 7950GX2 2x512MB^
nVidia Geforce 8800GTX 768MB ^

Read full topic

item.description:
@HeWhoOpensADoor wrote:

Nvidia 8800 GTX GPUS…all the way…they are 256MB and are Vista-Ready and as a little umm…thing…Crytek the dudes that are making Crysis which is possibly going to be one of the most beatifuliest games EVER…run Crysis on there PCs with Nvidia 8800 GTX GPU’s and if you havent seen any screens of Crysis yet, look at ign.com, go to search and type in “Crysis”
